meanings.definition: Rude or surly in a mean-spirited and surly way.
meanings.sent1: The churlishly man refused to help anyone.
meanings.sent2: She spoke churlishly to the waiter, making him feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The churlishly customer complained about everything in the store.
meanings.sent4: His churlishly behavior made him as prickly as a cactus.
meanings.sent5: The churlishly attitude of the boss made the office atmosphere tense.

meanings.definition: In a rude or surly manner.
meanings.sent1: He answered churlishly when asked about his day.
meanings.sent2: She glared churlishly at the person who bumped into her.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked churlishly at the mailman, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled churlishly through the night, keeping us awake.
meanings.sent5: The child stomped churlishly after being told it was bedtime.
